s1.title: Woody
s1.p: Woody is another form framework that can be used in your Flowscripts.
s1.note: Woody is marked as "unstable" block because it is under active development!

s2.title: The woody function
s2.p: The entry point to a Woody form is the woody() function:
You call the woody function from your sitemap to create a new form, for example:
s2.source: <map:match pattern="form1.flow"> <map:call function="woody"> <map:parameter name="function" value="form1"/> <map:parameter name="form-definition" value="forms/form1.xml"/> </map:call> </map:match>
s2.p: The function parameter specifies the name of a JavaScript function that will provide the form's flow. The form-definition parameter specifies the location of the Woody form definition of the form. The specified function will be called with one parameter, the newly created form.

To use Woody in a Flowscript you must load woody2.js into your script and define a function that takes one argument (form1 in the example at the top of this page). The argument passed to your function will be a JavaScript representation of your Woody form.

s2.title: Form Object
s2.p: Woody provides a JavaScript Form object that provides methods for you to manage your form's model and to invoke its associated view and any validation you've specified.
The Form object passed to your function has the following properties and functions:

s3.title: getModel
s3.p: Returns a JavaScript wrapper of the Woody <form> Widget.

s3.title: show
s3.p: This method repeatedly shows the form until validation is complete. If the validator function is supplied it will be called to do additional validation. The validator function will be called with one argument containing a reference to the form.

s3.title: getSubmitId
s3.p: Returns the id of the selected Woody <button> widget.

s3.title: finish
s3.p: Destroys this form and releases all of its resources.
